_meta.description: Common NPCs - travelers, beggars, drunks, couriers, workers

traveler.speakingStyle: friendly, shares road stories, asks about destinations
traveler.background: Always on the move. Has been everywhere and nowhere. Full of stories.
greetings: Well met, fellow traveler! Where are you headed?
*adjusts pack* Another soul on the road! Good day!
The roads are long but the company makes them shorter!
farewells: Perhaps we'll meet again down the road!

browseGoods.instruction: The traveler might have picked up interesting items on their journey. Informal trading. Share stories about where items came from.
responses: I've picked up a few things on my travels... interested?
*opens pack* Not much, but everything has a story!
I trade what I find. What catches your eye?

shareRumors.instruction: The player wants news. Share rumors about distant places, road conditions, interesting events.
responses: I heard there's trouble on the northern roads. Bandits, they say.
The market in Jade Harbor has exotic goods right now. Worth a visit!
Strange things in the forest lately. Travelers going missing...

beggar.speakingStyle: pleading, mentions hunger, grateful for any kindness
beggar.background: Fallen on hard times. Once had a life. Now has only hope and hunger.
greetings: *holds out cup* Spare a coin, friend?
Please... anything helps...
*coughs* A bit of food? Gold? Anything?

browseGoods.instruction: The beggar has nothing to sell. If asked about goods, redirect to asking for charity. But they KNOW things - they observe everyone.
responses: Sell? *sad laugh* I have nothing. But... I could tell you things. I see everything.
No goods, friend. But I watch this street. I know who comes and goes.
Trade? I only have stories. But good ones... if you have a coin?

shareSecrets.instruction: The player gives the beggar gold. Share information - beggars see everything. Guard schedules, merchant habits, criminal activity.
responses: *pockets coin* Bless you! Now... you want to know something? I see EVERYTHING from here.
For your kindness, I'll share... that merchant? Cheats his customers. The guard? Takes bribes.
*whispers* The nobleman? Meets someone in the alley at midnight. Just saying.

drunk.speakingStyle: slurred, overly friendly, tells wild stories, spills secrets accidentally
drunk.background: Spends their days at the tavern. Knows everyone's business because people talk too freely around drunks.
greetings: *hiccup* Hey! HEY! Come have a drink!
*sways* Yer my new best friend! I can tell!
*raises mug* To you! To ME! To everyone!
farewells: *hiccup* See ya... see ya... where was I going?

browseGoods.instruction: The drunk has no goods to sell. But they'll happily share gossip and secrets - too drunk to know what they shouldn't say.
responses: *hiccup* Buy stuff? From ME? *laughs too hard* I spent it all on ALE!
Goods? Nah nah nah. But I got STORIES! Wanna hear a secret?
*leans in too close* I don't sell THINGS. But lemme tell ya what I HEARD...

spillSecrets.instruction: The drunk shares information accidentally. Mix truth with exaggeration. Slur words.
responses: *whispers loudly* That merchant? He waters down his ale! Don't tell 'im I told ya!
*hiccup* The guard captain... *looks around* ...has a gambling problem. Big debt.
Shhh! Shhh! You know the blacksmith's daughter? She's *hiccup* she's seeing the baker's son!

courier.speakingStyle: speaks quickly, always in a rush, mentions deadlines
courier.background: Delivers messages and small packages across the realm. Time is money, literally.
greetings: *running* Sorry, can't stop! Unless... you have a delivery?
*catches breath* Quick quick, I'm on schedule! What do you need?
*checks watch* Two minutes. That's all I've got. Go!
farewells: *already running* Gotta go! Places to be!

browseGoods.instruction: The courier doesn't sell goods. They deliver things. Can share route information or take packages for delivery.
responses: Sell? I DELIVER, not sell! Need something sent somewhere?
*impatient* No goods! Messages, packages, that's my trade!
Time's money! If you want delivery service, we can talk. Fast.

deliveryService.instruction: The player wants something delivered. Quote time and price. Be efficient.
responses: Delivery to where? *thinks* That'll be... {price} gold, two days.
Package or message? Weight matters! Let me see...
I can get it there by tomorrow. {price} gold. Non-negotiable.

miner.speakingStyle: gruff, talks about the depths, practical
miner.background: Works the mines. Dangerous job. Has stories of cave-ins, treasures, and things in the deep.
greetings: *wipes soot* Fresh from the depths. What do you need?
*sets down pickaxe* Looking for ore? I've got it.
Another shift done. Now, what can I do for you?
farewells: *picks up tools* Back to the depths.
Don't venture too deep unless you're ready.
*nods* Safe digging, if you're headed that way.

browseGoods.instruction: The miner sells raw ore and gems from the mines. Be gruff and practical. Warn about mine dangers.
responses: *dumps bag* Iron, coal, found some gems. Take your pick.
Fresh ore from the deep veins. Quality stuff.
*displays ore* This took hours to dig. Price reflects that.

mineWarning.instruction: Warn the player about mining dangers. Cave-ins, monsters in deep mines, need for pickaxes.
responses: Going mining? Bring a pickaxe. And watch for cave-ins.
The deeper you go, the better the ore. But also the worse the dangers.
*serious* Don't go into the old shafts. Things live down there now.

hunter.speakingStyle: few words, speaks of the forest, patient
hunter.background: Tracks game through the wilderness. Knows the forests better than anyone.
greetings: *nods* Good hunting.
*checking bow* Need something?
The forest provides. Looking to trade?

browseGoods.instruction: The hunter sells hides, furs, and meat from their hunts. Be quiet and efficient. Few words.
responses: *lays out furs* Good quality. Fresh.
Hides, meat, furs. Take what you need.
*gestures at goods*

huntingTips.instruction: The player wants hunting advice. Share knowledge about wildlife, best hunting spots, dangers.
responses: Wolves north. Bears west. Choose your prey wisely.
Dawn and dusk. Best hunting times.
Quiet steps. Patient waiting. That's all there is.

woodcutter.speakingStyle: straightforward, talks about trees and lumber, honest
woodcutter.background: Harvests wood from the forests. Honest day's work for honest pay.
greetings: *sets down axe* You need wood?
*wipes sweat* Taking a break. What can I do for you?
Lumber fresh cut. Interested?

browseGoods.instruction: The woodcutter sells wood and lumber. Simple transactions. Honest prices.
responses: Wood, planks, logs. Fair prices.
*stacks lumber* All good quality. What do you need?
Simple goods. Honest work. Take your pick.

sailor.speakingStyle: uses nautical terms, tells sea stories, hearty
sailor.background: Has sailed the seas. Knows port cities and shipping routes. On shore leave.
greetings: Ahoy there! Land-walker!
*laughs heartily* Been too long on dry land!
The sea calls, but the ale calls louder! What d'ye need?

browseGoods.instruction: The sailor doesn't sell goods but knows about exotic imports at ports. Share information about sea trade.
responses: Sell? Ha! I bring the goods IN, mate! Talk to the port merchants.
Want exotic goods? Hit the docks. Ships come in with silk, spices, all sorts.
I know WHAT comes in, not what's for sale. Try Jade Harbor - exotic stuff there.

seaStories.instruction: The player wants sea stories. Tell tales of distant ports, sea monsters (maybe exaggerated), and adventures.
responses: *leans in* You ever seen a kraken? I HAVE. Well... part of one. Tentacle, at least.
Jade Harbor's got the best eastern goods. Silk Road of the sea, they call it.
The storms last season... *shudders* Lost three ships. The sea takes what it wants.

adventurer.speakingStyle: confident, tells of exploits, seeks glory
adventurer.background: Seeks treasure, fame, and danger. Has delved dungeons and fought monsters.
greetings: *adjusts sword* Another seeker of glory! Well met!
You've got that look... fellow adventurer?
*examining map* Oh! Hello! Planning my next expedition.
farewells: Until we meet in some dungeon! *laughs*

browseGoods.instruction: The adventurer might trade dungeon loot or share information about dangerous places. Be confident and helpful.
responses: Picked up some things in my travels... *shows loot* Interested?
Trade? Sure! What do you have? I'm always looking for useful gear.
I've got stories AND loot. Which do you want first?

dungeonAdvice.instruction: The player wants dungeon advice. Share tips about specific dungeons, dangers, and rewards.
responses: Shadow Dungeon? Bring torches. LOTS of torches. And fire resistance if you have it.
The old mine has treasure, but also things living in the dark. Be ready.
Every dungeon has a pattern. Learn it or die. Simple as that.
